title: Trump Meets Putin in Anchorage, Puts Business on Hold Over Ukraine Conflict
snippets: President Trump told reporters on Friday that he's willing to talk about business with Russian President Vladimir Putin, but said there would be no deals "until we get the war solved" in Ukraine.
President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin meet in Anchorage today to talk about Ukraine. Here's what to know.
Donald Trump is meeting Vladimir Putin on Friday, but the White House is signalling that major agreements are unlikely.
"Trump wants to exhaust all options to have a peaceful end to war," the White House said Thursday. Whether those "options" are good or bad for Ukraine is key.

The West has long sought to make Vladimir Putin a pariah over the bloodshed in Ukraine. But on Friday, the Russian leader will break out of international isolation and step foot on U.S. soil, welcomed by an American president eager to fulfill his promise of stopping the war. European leaders who hel
titles: Trump and Putin meet today in Anchorage. Here's what to know
Trump and Putin meet in Anchorage today
What to expect when Trump and Putin meet in Alaska
Nothing is off the table as Trump and Putin set to meet
What’s at stake as Trump and Putin meet in Alaska?
summary: President Donald Trump met with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Anchorage to discuss the situation in Ukraine. Trump expressed a willingness to engage in business discussions with Putin but emphasized that no deals would be made until the conflict in Ukraine is resolved. The White House indicated that while major agreements were unlikely at this meeting, Trump aimed to explore all options for a peaceful end to the war. This meeting marked a significant moment as Putin, who has been widely criticized by the West for his role in the Ukraine conflict, was welcomed in the U.S. by Trump, highli

title: DEA Head to Lead D.C. Police, Sparks Legal Challenge from City Leaders

The nation's capital has been challenging the president's move to seize control of its police force. City leaders have called it the gravest threat to autonomy from federal power in decades.

titles: Washington DC sues federal government over police takeover
Washington legal chief sues Trump over police takeover

Washington DC sues after Trump officials’ ‘hostile takeover’ of city police
summary: The DEA head, Terry Cole, has been appointed to assume control over the Metropolitan Police Department in Washington D.C., as stated by Pam Bondi. This move comes amidst a crackdown on crime by the White House. The city's leaders, viewing this as a significant threat to their autonomy, are challenging the president's decision. The D.C. attorney general has filed a lawsuit against this action, seeking an emergency restraining order to prevent the transfer of power.

title: Cloudburst in Pakistan and India Causes Flash Floods, 185 Dead
snippets: The majority of deaths were recorded in Pakistan's mountainous Khyber Pakhtunkhwa area.

Search for the missing continues in north-west after downpour also sparks deadly flooding and landslides in India

A massive cloudburst has triggered flash floods in north-west Pakistan, killing at least 157 people, as rescuers continued to search for people missing after floods in neighbour
The country has endured heavier rain during monsoon seasons, which scientists have attributed to climate change. The authorities said that at least 185 people died on Friday.
titles: Flash floods kill nearly 200 in Pakistan and Pakistan-administered Kashmir
Flash floods kill at least 159 people in Pakistan after huge cloudburst
Flash Floods in Pakistan Kill at Least 150 People in a Single Day
summary: A massive cloudburst in north-west Pakistan has resulted in flash floods, killing at least 157 people, with the majority of fatalities occurring in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa area. The incident also caused deadly flooding and landslides in neighboring India. Rescue operations are ongoing for those still missing. The region has experienced heavier monsoon rains, which scientists link to climate change. The total death toll reported by authorities on Friday reached at least 185.

title: EasyJet Planes Collide at Manchester Airport; No Injuries Reported
snippets: The aircraft, bound for Paris and Gibraltar, clip wings while taxiing at the airport.
Two easyJet planes clipped wings on the runway at Manchester International Airport in the United Kingdom on Friday morning, officials said.

Two aircraft clipped wings as they taxied to runway for takeoff, with no reports of injuries

Flights were briefly suspended at Manchester airport on Friday morning after two easyJet planes collided, clipping wings as they taxied to the runway for takeoff.

The aircraft, which were flyi
titles: EasyJet planes clip wings at Manchester Airport
2 easyJet planes clip wings at Manchester Airport in UK
Manchester airport suspends flights after easyJet planes collide
summary: Two easyJet planes collided, clipping wings while taxiing to the runway for takeoff at Manchester International Airport, UK, on Friday morning. There were no reported injuries. The incident briefly suspended flights at the airport. Both aircraft were bound for Paris and Gibraltar.

title: Global Plastic Pollution Treaty Talks End Without Agreement
snippets: Several delegates express dismay at the failure to break a deadlock at the sixth round of talks in under three years.

Negotiations aimed at tacking plastic pollution have concluded without an agreement. Countries differed on how ambitious the treaty should be and whether to focus on cutting plastic production or waste management.
Countries failed to bridge wide gaps on whether the world should limit plastic manufacturing and restrict the use of harmful plastic chemicals.
titles: Geneva talks on global plastic pollution treaty collapse without a deal
UN talks on plastic pollution fail to reach deal
United Nations Plastic Treaty Talks End Without Deal
summary: Negotiations to create a global treaty on plastic pollution ended without an agreement. Countries could not agree on the treaty's ambition level, whether to focus on reducing plastic production or improving waste management, and if it should include legally binding measures to curb production and address toxic chemicals. The talks aimed at addressing the increasing issue of plastic pollution concluded with no consensus reached.

title: Canada Post, Union Meeting Delayed Amid Air Canada Talks
snippets: The Canadian Union of Postal Workers said talks had been postponed because federal mediators were unavailable 'due to their current involvement in the Air Canada negotiations.'

OTTAWA — A meeting between Canada Post and the union representing 55,000 postal workers has been delayed until next week due to the availability of federal mediators, the company says. The two sides, which were set to meet Friday, will now meet on Aug. 20. It’s been two weeks since members of
titles: Canada Post strike talks with union delayed to next week
Canada Post and union meeting delayed until next week due to mediator availability
summary: A scheduled meeting between Canada Post and the union representing 55,000 postal workers was postponed to Aug. 20 due to federal mediators being occupied with Air Canada negotiations. This delay was announced after the two parties were initially set to meet, marking two weeks since discussions were last held.

The meeting, involving top diplomatic, military, and economic officials from both nations, indicates a broad discussion agenda beyond the conflict. The outcome could significantly influence the direction of the Ukraine war and the overall security landscape in Europe.

title: Trump Meets Putin in Alaska Over Ukraine, Outcome Uncertain
snippets: After promising to solve the Ukraine war throughout his campaign, the US president faces a moment of truth in Alaska
Ukrainian refugees in Alaska have mixed feelings about US and Russian leaders’ meeting

Flying to Alaska to meet with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, President Trump said he had a “wonderful talk” with the authoritarian leader of Belarus. The comments added new uncertainty about Mr. Trump’s efforts to persuade Russia to end the war in Ukraine.

Despite Trump describing a "wonderful talk" with Belarus's leader en route, the meeting has sparked mixed reactions among Ukrainian refugees in Alaska and raised doubts about Trump's ability to persuade Russia to cease hostilities in Ukraine. The outcome of the talks remains uncertain, reflecting the complexity of the situation.

summary: Vectus Global, headed by Erik Prince, secured a contract to combat gang violence in Haiti and aid in reinstating tax collection. Between April and June, Haiti experienced significant violence, resulting in at least 1,520 deaths and over 600 injuries.

snippets: Sergio Castillo made up for an earlier miss in a big way when he booted a 47-yard field as time expired to lift the Blue Bombers to a 30-27 victory over the Ottawa Redblacks on Thursday.

WINNIPEG — Sergio Castillo was grateful he got a second chance. The Blue Bombers kicker made up for an earlier miss in a big way when he booted a 47-yard field goal as time expired to lift Winnipeg to a 30-27 victory over the Ottawa Redblacks on Thursday. Winnipeg was ahead 17-0 after the firs

summary: Sergio Castillo kicked a 47-yard field goal as time expired, securing a 30-27 win for the Winnipeg Blue Bombers over the Ottawa Redblacks. This victory came after Winnipeg had led 17-0 in the first half, and Castillo redeemed himself from an earlier miss in the game.

title: U.S. Government Investment Boosts Intel, Stocks Hit High Since March

titles: CUPE: Air Canada is Reinforcing the Gender Wage Gap – And They Want the Government to Help Them Do It
summary: Air Canada has proposed a wage offer to its flight attendants, 70% of whom are women, that is less than one-third of what was offered to its predominantly male pilot workforce less than a year ago. This has raised concerns about reinforcing the gender wage gap within the company.

This initiative aims to keep tabs on American players competing in Europe as they strive to secure spots on the national team for the World Cup.

title: WNBA Expands to Canada with Toronto Tempo Team
snippets: In less than a year, the WNBA will no longer be a one-country league. As the league holds its first regular-season game outside the U.S., Sarah Maat takes a look at the excitement building around the Toronto Tempo.
titles: How the Toronto Tempo are working to become Canada’s team
summary: The WNBA is set to expand beyond the United States for the first time, with the introduction of the Toronto Tempo. This expansion will occur within the next year, marking a significant milestone as the league holds its first regular-season game in Toronto, Canada. This move has generated excitement around the new team and the league's growth.

title: Durant, Davis Set for Emotional Returns to Former Teams in November Games
snippets: The Rockets' Kevin Durant will make his return to Phoenix on Nov. 24, while the Mavericks' Anthony Davis will return to Los Angeles to play the Lakers on Nov. 28.

summary: Kevin Durant of the Houston Rockets is set to return to Phoenix for a game on November 24. Similarly, Anthony Davis from the Dallas Mavericks will play against the Lakers in Los Angeles on November 28. These scheduled games mark significant returns for both players to their former team cities.

title: New Nanobody Tech Targets, Destroys Lung Cancer Cells
snippets: A research team has developed a nanobody-based technology that can precisely identify and attack only lung cancer cells, opening new possibilities for cancer therapy.
titles: Precision nanobody acts as 'drone strike' against lung cancer cells, minimizing side effects
summary: A research team has created a nanobody technology that targets and destroys lung cancer cells specifically, offering potential advancements in cancer treatment. This innovation could lead to more effective and precise therapies for lung cancer patients.

title: Ancient Lakes in Tibesti Mountains Existed Over 5,000 Years, Study Finds
snippets: An interdisciplinary research team led by scientists from Freie Universität Berlin and the Max Planck Institute for Meteorology has shown how deep lakes formed more than 9,500 years ago in the craters of the Tibesti Mountains and existed there for more than 5,000 years.
titles: Study explains mystery of former crater lakes in the highest mountain range of the Sahara
summary: A research team from Freie Universität Berlin and the Max Planck Institute for Meteorology discovered that deep lakes formed in the craters of the Tibesti Mountains over 9,500 years ago and remained for more than 5,000 years. This interdisciplinary study sheds light on ancient climatic conditions in the region.

title: Kyiv Deploys US-Made Patriot System Against Russian Missiles
snippets: The US-made Patriot air defense system is Kyiv's best tool for intercepting Russian ballistic missiles.

title: Trump Federalizes DC Police, Deploys National Guard
snippets: Trump on Monday federalized the Washington, D.C., police department and ordered the deployment of National Guard troops in the capital city.
titles: Judge sets hearing Friday on lawsuit challenging Trump takeover of DC police force
summary: On Monday, President Trump issued orders to federalize the Washington, D.C., police department and to deploy National Guard troops in the capital city. This action places the local police under federal control and introduces military presence in response to unspecified circumstances.

title: Chinese Scientists Innovate Crop Pollination, Aim for Resilience
snippets: For millennia, developing resilient crops relied on pollination by nature or humans—making the process long and often costly. Now, scientists from the Institute of Genetics and Developmental Biology (IGDB) of the Chinese Academy of Sciences have reimagined the pollination process by developing a new
titles: Flowers redesigned for robots: Gene editing and AI promise faster crop breeding
summary: Scientists at the Institute of Genetics and Developmental Biology, part of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, have innovated the traditional crop pollination process. This new method aims to make developing resilient crops faster and less expensive than the millennia-old techniques reliant on natural or human-assisted pollination.

title: Rare Subtropical Wood Stork Spotted in Wisconsin
snippets: A very rare and apparently very confused subtropical wood stork somehow found its way to the wilds of Wisconsin.

summary: A subtropical wood stork, typically not found in the region, was unexpectedly spotted in Wisconsin. This rare occurrence highlights the unusual presence of a species far from its normal habitat, emphasizing the bird's apparent confusion or displacement.

title: Bumblebee Catfish Observed Climbing Waterfalls in Brazil for First Time
snippets: Nature often puts on incredible displays. A recent example caught on camera shows thousands of bumblebee catfish (Rhyacoglanis paranensis) climbing waterfalls in southern Brazil. This is the first time the species has been observed in such a large group and climbing, according to a study published i
titles: Moving up in the world: Rare catfish species filmed climbing waterfalls
summary: For the first time, thousands of bumblebee catfish were observed climbing waterfalls in southern Brazil, as captured in a recent study. This remarkable behavior, never before documented for this species (Rhyacoglanis paranensis), highlights an extraordinary natural phenomenon and has been published in a scientific study, marking a significant observation in the species' behavior.

title: Apatite: Key Mineral for Healthy Teeth and Bones
snippets: Apatite. Rhymes with appetite, and fittingly, plays a vital role in the very act of eating. Found in teeth and bones, apatite provides the structural strength behind every bite and step we take.
titles: Apatite: The mineral with bite and insight
summary: Apatite, a mineral that shares a phonetic resemblance with "appetite," is crucial for human health as it forms the structural foundation of teeth and bones. This mineral enables the essential functions of eating and movement by providing the necessary strength for biting and walking.

title: Study Reveals How Radiation Affects Graphite in Nuclear Reactors
snippets: Graphite is a key structural component in some of the world's oldest nuclear reactors and many of the next-generation designs being built today. But it also condenses and swells in response to radiation—and the mechanism behind those changes has proven difficult to study.
titles: Graphite's pore size distribution offers new clues to predicting nuclear reactor material failure
summary: Graphite, crucial for both old and next-gen nuclear reactors, undergoes condensation and swelling due to radiation, a process that has been challenging to understand. This phenomenon affects the structural integrity of reactors, making its study vital for safety and efficiency in nuclear energy production.

title: 80th Anniversary of Japan's Surrender, Ending WWII for Australia
snippets: Eighty years ago this week, Japan surrendered after nearly four years of war in the Asia-Pacific. For Australia, this meant the end of not only the war in the Pacific, but also the Second World War that had begun six years earlier, in September 1939.
titles: New research shows WWII dominates Australians' knowledge of military history. But big gaps remain
summary: This week marks the 80th anniversary of Japan's surrender, concluding nearly four years of conflict in the Asia-Pacific and ending the Second World War for Australia. The war, which began in September 1939, spanned six years, significantly impacting the global landscape.
